sentences.english: Ice chilly voice, let people have a tiny heart palpitates.
sentences.chinese: 冰寒的嗓音，讓人有點心悸。

sentences.english: Then there is the problem that all transitions are bureaucratic nightmares.
sentences.chinese: 最後，移交是一個行政程序上的令人心悸的麻煩事。

sentences.english: Now before you fall asleep, do you have any dizziness or palpitations?
sentences.chinese: 那在你入睡前你有感到頭暈眩或心悸嗎？

sentences.english: There was obvious relationship between type of arrhythmia and symptom of heart-throb.
sentences.chinese: 心律失常類型與心悸症狀之間有明顯關係。

sentences.english: She may feel, for example, palpitations and hot flushes.
sentences.chinese: 她也許會感到，舉個例子來說吧，心悸，潮熱。

sentences.english: A relatively modern application for valerian is for treating high blood pressure and palpitations.
sentences.chinese: 頡草的一個現代相關的應用是治療高血壓與心悸。

sentences.english: The clinical manifestations were palpitation and cyanosis.
sentences.chinese: 臨牀表現爲心悸和紫紺。

sentences.english: There is usually trembling, faintness and palpitations, and there may be profuse sweating.
sentences.chinese: 通常有顫抖，頭暈和心悸，可能有豐富的出汗。

sentences.english: He started having chest pains and heart palpitations during this time.
sentences.chinese: 這段時間，他開始感到胸痛，心悸。

sentences.english: He was always a 'nervous' person but more so since the onset of palpitation.
sentences.chinese: 他老是神經過敏，自從心悸發生後更加厲害。

sentences.english: Once dialed randomly my palpitation's person, now do I how possibly forget you.
sentences.chinese: 一旦隨機撥打我心悸的人，現在做我怎麼可能忘記你。

sentences.english: To confess the truth, I began to feel dizzy and then I got palpitations and felt limp.
sentences.chinese: 說實在話，我起初感覺眩暈，然後心悸虛弱無力。

sentences.english: When sad, only has that one wipes the carry-over red late autumn, palpitates the heart.
sentences.chinese: 憂傷時，唯有那一抹遺留的深秋之紅，令心悸動。

sentences.english: My heart throbbed, singing in my chest.
sentences.chinese: 我的心悸動着，在我胸腔中鳴叫。

sentences.english: And then allowed to develop will be prone to breathing difficulties, heart palpitations and chest pain symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 再任其發展會容易出現呼吸困難，心悸和胸痛的症狀。

definition: shaking in fear/one's heart palpitating with fear
sharp pain/cramp/griping pain/colic/angina, cf 心絞痛|心绞痛
vertigo/dizziness/fainting/feeling of swaying, head spinning, lack of balance or floating (e.g. from a stroke)/Taiwan pr. [xuan4 yun1]
to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
